games.title: Super Mario Bros.
games.description: Super Mario Bros. is a platform video game developed and published by Nintendo. The successor to the 1983 arcade game Mario Bros. and the first in the Super Mario series, it was originally released in 1985 for the Famicom in Japan.
games.longDescription: In Super Mario Bros., the player controls Mario as he travels through the Mushroom Kingdom in order to rescue Princess Toadstool from the antagonist Bowser. The game is a side-scrolling platformer; the player moves from the left side of the screen to the right side in order to reach the flag pole at the end of each level.

games.title: Super Mario Bros. 3
games.description: Super Mario Bros. 3 is a platform video game developed and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo Entertainment System. It was released in Japan in 1988 and later in North America in 1990.
games.longDescription: The game features eight worlds with a total of 90 levels. The player controls Mario or Luigi and attempts to save Princess Toadstool and the rulers of seven different kingdoms from Bowser and his children, the Koopalings.

games.title: The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening
games.description: The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening is an action-adventure game developed and published by Nintendo as the fourth installment in The Legend of Zelda series.
games.longDescription: It is the first game in the series to be released on a handheld console and the first set outside of Hyrule. Link's Awakening is set on Koholint Island, where Link washes ashore after a storm destroys his boat.

games.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
games.description: Sonic the Hedgehog is a platform video game developed by Sonic Team and published by Sega for the Sega Genesis console.
games.longDescription: The game features an anthropomorphic hedgehog named Sonic in a quest to defeat Doctor Robotnik, a scientist who has imprisoned animals in robots and stolen the magical Chaos Emeralds.

games.title: Tetris
games.description: Tetris is a tile-matching puzzle video game originally designed and programmed by Alexey Pajitnov in the Soviet Union.
games.longDescription: The goal is to place the falling Tetromino pieces to create horizontal lines of blocks without gaps. When such a line is created, it disappears, and any blocks above fall down to fill the space.

games.title: Metroid
games.description: Metroid is an action-adventure game franchise created by Nintendo. The player controls the space-faring bounty hunter Samus Aran, who protects the galaxy from the Space Pirates and their attempts to harness the power of the parasitic Metroid creatures.
games.longDescription: The original Metroid was influenced by two other major Nintendo franchises: Mario, from which it borrowed extensive side-scrolling gameplay elements; and The Legend of Zelda, from which it borrowed non-linear exploration.

games.title: Donkey Kong Country
games.description: Donkey Kong Country is a platform video game developed by Rare and published by Nintendo for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System.
games.longDescription: The game follows a gorilla named Donkey Kong and his nephew Diddy Kong as they adventure through their home, Donkey Kong Island, to recover their stolen banana hoard from the crocodilian villains, the Kremlings, and their leader King K. Rool.

games.title: Pac-Man
games.description: Pac-Man is a maze action video game developed and released by Namco for arcades in 1980.
games.longDescription: In North America, the game was released by Midway Manufacturing as part of its licensing agreement with Namco America. The player controls Pac-Man, who must eat all the dots inside an enclosed maze while avoiding four colored ghosts.

games.title: Street Fighter II
games.description: Street Fighter II is a fighting game developed by Capcom and originally released for arcades in 1991.
games.longDescription: It is the sequel to 1987's Street Fighter and the second game in the Street Fighter series. The game's playable characters originate from different countries around the world, each with a unique fighting style.

games.title: Pokémon Red
games.description: Pokémon Red Version is a role-playing video game developed by Game Freak and published by Nintendo for the Game Boy handheld game console.
games.longDescription: The games are set in the fictional Kanto region and follow the story of a young trainer as they train Pokémon for competition against other trainers while simultaneously thwarting the criminal organization Team Rocket.

games.title: Super Metroid
games.description: Super Metroid is an action-adventure game developed by Nintendo R&D1 and Intelligent Systems and published by Nintendo for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System.
games.longDescription: The game was directed and written by Yoshio Sakamoto, and produced by Makoto Kano with Gunpei Yokoi serving as general manager. It is the third game in the Metroid series and a sequel to the Game Boy game Metroid II: Return of Samus.

games.title: Chrono Trigger
games.description: Chrono Trigger is a role-playing video game developed and published by Square for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System.
games.longDescription: Chrono Trigger's development team included three designers that Square dubbed the 'Dream Team': Hironobu Sakaguchi, the creator of Square's Final Fantasy series; Yuji Horii, a freelance designer and creator of Enix's Dragon Quest series; and Akira Toriyama, a freelance manga artist famed for his work with Dragon Quest and Dragon Ball.

games.title: Final Fantasy VII
games.description: Final Fantasy VII is a role-playing video game developed by Square for the PlayStation console and was released in 1997.
games.longDescription: It is the seventh main installment in the Final Fantasy series. Published in Japan by Square, it was released in other regions by Sony Computer Entertainment and became the first in the main series to see a PAL release.

games.title: Mario Kart 64
games.description: Mario Kart 64 is a kart racing video game developed and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo 64 video game console.
games.longDescription: The game is the sequel to Super Mario Kart for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System. It was the second game in the Mario Kart series and the first to feature 3D graphics.

games.title: GoldenEye 007
games.description: GoldenEye 007 is a first-person shooter video game developed by Rare and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo 64.
games.longDescription: The game is based on the 1995 James Bond film GoldenEye, with the player controlling the secret agent James Bond to prevent a criminal syndicate from using a satellite weapon.

games.title: Pokémon Sapphire
games.description: Pokémon Ruby and Sapphire are role-playing video games developed by Game Freak and published by Nintendo for the Game Boy Advance.
games.longDescription: They are the first installments in the third generation of the Pokémon video game series, also known as the advanced generation. The games are set in the fictional Hoenn region.

games.title: Crash Bandicoot
games.description: Crash Bandicoot is a platform video game developed by Naughty Dog and published by Sony Computer Entertainment for the PlayStation.
games.longDescription: The player controls Crash, a bandicoot tasked with traversing 32 levels to defeat Doctor Neo Cortex and rescue Tawna. The game is played from a third-person perspective in which the camera trails behind Crash.

games.title: Contra
games.description: Contra is a run-and-gun shooter video game developed and published by Konami for arcades in 1987.
games.longDescription: The game is set in the distant future when two commandos are sent to neutralize a terrorist organization known as the Red Falcon that is planning to take over the Earth.

games.title: Mega Man 2
games.description: Mega Man 2 is an action platform video game developed and published by Capcom for the Nintendo Entertainment System.
games.longDescription: It is the second installment in the original Mega Man series. The game was released in Japan in 1988 and in North America and PAL regions the following year.

games.title: Castlevania
games.description: Castlevania is a platform game developed and published by Konami for the Family Computer Disk System video game console.
games.longDescription: Castlevania was ported to cartridge format and released for the Nintendo Entertainment System in May 1987. The game takes place in 1691 where players control Simon Belmont on his quest to defeat the vampire Dracula.
